data.text: Of or relating to machines or tools.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Operated or produced by a mechanism or machine.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Of, relating to, or governed by mechanics.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Performed or performing in an impersonal or machinelike manner; automatic.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a droning, mechanical delivery of the speech.

data.text: Relating to, produced by, or dominated by physical forces.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: the mechanical aspect of trumpet playing.

data.text: Interpreting and explaining the phenomena of the universe by referring to causally determined material forces; mechanistic.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Of or relating to manual labor, its tools, and its skills.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A layout consisting of type proofs, artwork, or both, exactly positioned and prepared for making an offset or other printing plate.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Pertaining to or exhibiting constructive power; of or pertaining to mechanism or machinery; also, dependent upon the use of mechanism; of the nature or character of a machine or machinery: as, mechanical inventions or contrivances; to do something by mechanical means.

Machine-like; acting or actuated by or as if by machinery, or by fixed routine; lacking spontaneity, spirit, individuality, etc.; as applied to actions, automatic, instinctive, unconscious, etc.: as, the mechanical action of the heart; a mechanical musician.
